     295             :    * Post-processes layers before composition. This performs the following:

     587             : 
     588             : /**
     589             :  * Composite layers are for use with OMTC on the compositor thread only. There
     590             :  * must be corresponding Client layers on the content thread. For composite
     591             :  * layers, the layer manager only maintains the layer tree, all rendering is
     592             :  * done by a Compositor (see Compositor.h). As such, composite layers are
     593             :  * platform-independent and can be used on any platform for which there is a
     594             :  * Compositor implementation.
     595             :  *
     596             :  * The composite layer tree reflects exactly the basic layer tree. To
     597             :  * composite to screen, the layer manager walks the layer tree calling render
     598             :  * methods which in turn call into their CompositableHosts' Composite methods.
     599             :  * These call Compositor::DrawQuad to do the rendering.
     600             :  *
     601             :  * Mostly, layers are updated during the layers transaction. This is done from
     602             :  * CompositableClient to CompositableHost without interacting with the layer.
     603             :  *
     604             :  * A reference to the Compositor is stored in LayerManagerComposite.
     605             :  */
     606             : class LayerComposite : public HostLayer
     607             : {
     608             : public:
     609             :   explicit LayerComposite(LayerManagerComposite* aManager);
     610             : 
     611             :   virtual ~LayerComposite();
     612             : 
     613             :   virtual void SetLayerManager(HostLayerManager* aManager);
     614             : 
     615           0 :   virtual LayerComposite* GetFirstChildComposite()
     616             :   {
     617           0 :     return nullptr;
     618             :   }
     619             : 
     620             :   /* Do NOT call this from the generic LayerComposite destructor.  Only from the
     621             :    * concrete class destructor
     622             :    */
     623             :   virtual void Destroy();
     624           0 :   virtual void Cleanup() {}
     625             : 
     626             :   /**
     627             :    * Perform a first pass over the layer tree to render all of the intermediate
     628             :    * surfaces that we can. This allows us to avoid framebuffer switches in the
     629             :    * middle of our render which is inefficient especially on mobile GPUs. This
     630             :    * must be called before RenderLayer.
     631             :    */
     632           0 :   virtual void Prepare(const RenderTargetIntRect& aClipRect) {}
     633             : 
     634             :   // TODO: This should also take RenderTargetIntRect like Prepare.
     635             :   virtual void RenderLayer(const gfx::IntRect& aClipRect,
     636             :                            const Maybe<gfx::Polygon>& aGeometry) = 0;

     686             : 
     687             : // Render aLayer using aCompositor and apply all mask layers of aLayer: The
     688             : // layer's own mask layer (aLayer->GetMaskLayer()), and any ancestor mask
     689             : // layers.
     690             : // If more than one mask layer needs to be applied, we use intermediate surfaces
     691             : // (CompositingRenderTargets) for rendering, applying one mask layer at a time.
     692             : // Callers need to provide a callback function aRenderCallback that does the
     693             : // actual rendering of the source. It needs to have the following form:
     694             : // void (EffectChain& effectChain, const Rect& clipRect)
     695             : // aRenderCallback is called exactly once, inside this function, unless aLayer's
     696             : // visible region is completely clipped out (in that case, aRenderCallback won't
     697             : // be called at all).
     698             : // This function calls aLayer->AsHostLayer()->AddBlendModeEffect for the
     699             : // final rendering pass.
     700             : //
     701             : // (This function should really live in LayerManagerComposite.cpp, but we
     702             : // need to use templates for passing lambdas until bug 1164522 is resolved.)
     703             : template<typename RenderCallbackType>
     704             : void
     705           0 : RenderWithAllMasks(Layer* aLayer, Compositor* aCompositor,
     706             :                    const gfx::IntRect& aClipRect,
     707             :                    RenderCallbackType aRenderCallback)
     708             : {
     709           0 :   Layer* firstMask = nullptr;
     710           0 :   size_t maskLayerCount = 0;
     711           0 :   size_t nextAncestorMaskLayer = 0;
     712             : 
     713           0 :   size_t ancestorMaskLayerCount = aLayer->GetAncestorMaskLayerCount();
     714           0 :   if (Layer* ownMask = aLayer->GetMaskLayer()) {
     715           0 :     firstMask = ownMask;
     716           0 :     maskLayerCount = ancestorMaskLayerCount + 1;
     717           0 :     nextAncestorMaskLayer = 0;
     718           0 :   } else if (ancestorMaskLayerCount > 0) {
     719           0 :     firstMask = aLayer->GetAncestorMaskLayerAt(0);
     720           0 :     maskLayerCount = ancestorMaskLayerCount;
     721           0 :     nextAncestorMaskLayer = 1;
     722             :   } else {
     723             :     // no mask layers at all
     724             :   }
     725             : 
     726           0 :   if (maskLayerCount <= 1) {
     727             :     // This is the common case. Render in one pass and return.
     728             :     EffectChain effectChain(aLayer);
     729             :     LayerManagerComposite::AutoAddMaskEffect
     730           0 :       autoMaskEffect(firstMask, effectChain);
     731           0 :     static_cast<LayerComposite*>(aLayer->AsHostLayer())->AddBlendModeEffect(effectChain);
     732           0 :     aRenderCallback(effectChain, aClipRect);
     733           0 :     return;
     734             :   }
     735             : 
     736             :   // We have multiple mask layers.
     737             :   // We split our list of mask layers into three parts:
     738             :   //  (1) The first mask
     739             :   //  (2) The list of intermediate masks (every mask except first and last)
     740             :   //  (3) The final mask.
     741             :   // Part (2) can be empty.
     742             :   // For parts (1) and (2) we need to allocate intermediate surfaces to render
     743             :   // into. The final mask gets rendered into the original render target.
     744             : 
     745             :   // Calculate the size of the intermediate surfaces.
     746           0 :   gfx::Rect visibleRect(aLayer->GetLocalVisibleRegion().ToUnknownRegion().GetBounds());
     747           0 :   gfx::Matrix4x4 transform = aLayer->GetEffectiveTransform();
     748             :   // TODO: Use RenderTargetIntRect and TransformBy here
     749             :   gfx::IntRect surfaceRect =
     750           0 :     RoundedOut(transform.TransformAndClipBounds(visibleRect, gfx::Rect(aClipRect)));
     751           0 :   if (surfaceRect.IsEmpty()) {
     752             :     return;
     753             :   }
     754             : 
     755             :   RefPtr<CompositingRenderTarget> originalTarget =
     756           0 :     aCompositor->GetCurrentRenderTarget();
     757             : 
     758             :   RefPtr<CompositingRenderTarget> firstTarget =
     759           0 :     aCompositor->CreateRenderTarget(surfaceRect, INIT_MODE_CLEAR);
     760           0 :   if (!firstTarget) {
     761           0 :     return;
     762             :   }
     763             : 
     764             :   // Render the source while applying the first mask.
     765           0 :   aCompositor->SetRenderTarget(firstTarget);
     766             :   {
     767             :     EffectChain firstEffectChain(aLayer);
     768             :     LayerManagerComposite::AutoAddMaskEffect
     769           0 :       firstMaskEffect(firstMask, firstEffectChain);
     770           0 :     aRenderCallback(firstEffectChain, aClipRect - surfaceRect.TopLeft());
     771             :     // firstTarget now contains the transformed source with the first mask and
     772             :     // opacity already applied.
     773             :   }
     774             : 
     775             :   // Apply the intermediate masks.
     776           0 :   gfx::IntRect intermediateClip(surfaceRect - surfaceRect.TopLeft());
     777           0 :   RefPtr<CompositingRenderTarget> previousTarget = firstTarget;
     778           0 :   for (size_t i = nextAncestorMaskLayer; i < ancestorMaskLayerCount - 1; i++) {
     779           0 :     Layer* intermediateMask = aLayer->GetAncestorMaskLayerAt(i);
     780             :     RefPtr<CompositingRenderTarget> intermediateTarget =
     781           0 :       aCompositor->CreateRenderTarget(surfaceRect, INIT_MODE_CLEAR);
     782           0 :     if (!intermediateTarget) {
     783             :       break;
     784             :     }
     785           0 :     aCompositor->SetRenderTarget(intermediateTarget);
     786           0 :     EffectChain intermediateEffectChain(aLayer);
     787             :     LayerManagerComposite::AutoAddMaskEffect
     788           0 :       intermediateMaskEffect(intermediateMask, intermediateEffectChain);
     789           0 :     if (intermediateMaskEffect.Failed()) {
     790           0 :       continue;
     791             :     }
     792           0 :     intermediateEffectChain.mPrimaryEffect = new EffectRenderTarget(previousTarget);
     793           0 :     aCompositor->DrawQuad(gfx::Rect(surfaceRect), intermediateClip,
     794           0 :                           intermediateEffectChain, 1.0, gfx::Matrix4x4());
     795           0 :     previousTarget = intermediateTarget;
     796             :   }
     797             : 
     798           0 :   aCompositor->SetRenderTarget(originalTarget);
     799             : 
     800             :   // Apply the final mask, rendering into originalTarget.
     801           0 :   EffectChain finalEffectChain(aLayer);
     802           0 :   finalEffectChain.mPrimaryEffect = new EffectRenderTarget(previousTarget);
     803           0 :   Layer* finalMask = aLayer->GetAncestorMaskLayerAt(ancestorMaskLayerCount - 1);
     804             : 
     805             :   // The blend mode needs to be applied in this final step, because this is
     806             :   // where we're blending with the actual background (which is in originalTarget).
     807           0 :   static_cast<LayerComposite*>(aLayer->AsHostLayer())->AddBlendModeEffect(finalEffectChain);
     808           0 :   LayerManagerComposite::AutoAddMaskEffect autoMaskEffect(finalMask, finalEffectChain);
     809           0 :   if (!autoMaskEffect.Failed()) {
     810           0 :     aCompositor->DrawQuad(gfx::Rect(surfaceRect), aClipRect,
     811           0 :                           finalEffectChain, 1.0, gfx::Matrix4x4());
     812           0 :   }
     813             : }
